data.title: Meet the Queens of RuPaul's Drag Race Down Under Series 3
data.meta_description: RuPaul, award-winning Host and Executive Producer returns to BBC Three, the home of RuPaulâs Drag Race UK, with a brand-new series of RuPaulâs Drag Race Down Under this July
data.text:
RuPaul is back in the bush and is on the hunt for the Next Drag Superstar from Down Under and the fiercely competitive, heart-warming show will be aired exclusively on iPlayer and BBC Three this Summer.

Ahead of the return of RuPaulâs Drag Race UK later this year, BBC three viewers can look to the Antipodeans for their Summer Drag Race fix as ten fabulous Aussie and Kiwi queens compete across eight weeks in a series of challenges designed to test their drag skills to the max.

Queen of queens, Mama Ru will rule supreme on the judging panel joined by her Drag Race bestie, Michelle Visage and regular Down Under judge, Rhys Nicholson.

The ten bonzer Aussie and Kiwi queens competing for a cash prize of 50,000 AUD include: Amyl, Ashley Madison, Bumpa Love, Flor, Gabriella Labucci, Hollywould Star, Isis Avis Loren, Ivana Drink, Ivory Glaze, and Rita Menu.

This series continues the Drag Race Legacy of award-winning competitive reality brimming with big personalities and littered with love, light and gag-worthy moments.

RuPaul says:âAustralasian drag is filled with heart and humour, and Iâm thrilled to share my season three queens to the world, for all to see their charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and talent.â

Can Ru believe it? BBC Three will release the eight-part series weekly on BBC iPlayer, transmitted in line with Australia and New Zealand. The first episode will be available on BBC Three and BBC iPlayer from 8am on 28 July.

RuPaulâs Drag Race Down Under is a World of Wonder production in collaboration with Warner Bros International Television Production New Zealand for TVNZ and Stan. Fenton Bailey, Randy Barbato, Tom Campbell and RuPaul Charles serve as Executive Producers. Passion Distribution will distribute the series globally in line with Passion Distribution and WOWâs distribution strategy.

EL

Meet the Drag Race Down Under Series Three Queens

Amyl

27, Sydney Australia

Pronouns in drag: She/Her

Pronouns out of drag: He/They

Born in Colombia but raised in Sydney, Amylâs started doing drag in 2019., but she has already established herself as an up-and-coming performer on the Sydney Drag scene and made her mark as a fashionista, modelling in the Australian fashion magazines and cementing herself as a runway model, walking as part of Australian Fashion Week.

Ashley Madison

25, Melbourne Australia

Pronouns in drag: She/They

Pronouns out of drag: She/He/They

Hailing from Melbourne, Australiaâs epicentre of arts and entertainment, Ashley Madison has established herself as one of the most notable drag queens that Melbourne has to offer. Ashley Madison has been doing drag for eight years and during this time has garnered many accolades such as 1st runner up at the Miss Gay Australia Pageant and also Belle of the Ball at the Drag Industry Variety Awards (DIVA).

Not one to put all of her eggs in one basket, not only is she a DJ, but Ashley also owns and runs her own 3D jewellery business.

Bumpa Love

51, Melbourne Australia

Pronouns in drag: She/Her

Pronouns out of drag: He/Him

Bumpa Love has been entertaining audiences in Australia and New Zealand for 25 years. Yes, thatâs right twenty-five years â and so not only is she the oldest queen of the cast, but sheâs the most experienced.

Bumpa is a multi- talented driven queen who is fully immersed in the Melbourne drag scene and passionate about her work promoting LGBT culture.

She runs Australiaâs only Drag Queen-owned and produced venue, Vau dâvile Drag Cabaret, performing to sold-out houses all year round, and she has produced Aucklandâs fabulous night-time Pride Parade, MC for the Candlelight Aids Memorial (part of the 2014 International Aids Conference), creator of Melbourneâs Drag Awards, a member of the Yarra City Rainbow Advisory Committee and has produced work shown at Melbourne Fringe, Melbourne Comedy Festival, and Midsumma Festival.

Flor

25, Auckland New Zealand

Pronouns in drag: She/Her

Pronouns out of drag: He/Him

Flor has big reptation as a party queen with top notch make up skills, and an infectious smile. Born in Guatemala and now living in Auckland, Flor is a sultry Latin queen, who has been doing drag for six years.

Representing the Latin communities of Aotearoa and Auckland, Florâs drag name was inspired by her mother.

Indeed, Florâs main inspiration is strong Latin women who are aware of their voices and stay true to who they are.

Gabriella Labucci

31, Victoria Australia

Pronouns in drag: She/Her

Pronouns out of drag: He/Him

Gabriella Labucci is a force to be reckoned with in the world of cabaret and drag performance. Located in country Victoria (Ballarat) her talents include but are not limited to drag, singing, dancing, roller skating, modelling, hosting, and acting.

She has a heart of gold and a unique sense of humour and style.

Hollywould Star

34, NSW Australia

Pronouns in drag: She/Her

Pronouns out of drag: He/Him

Born in the United States, Hollywould has called New South Wales home for the past 9 years. Hollywould is classically trained as a singer, touring the world and performing in major stage productions like The Book of Mormon and Kinky Boots as well as slaying the floors of Sydney nightclubs. They most recently were seen performing as a Destiny Child Member with the Grammy Award-winning Kelly ROWLAND at the 2023 Domain Dance Party for Sydney World Pride and also appearing as a headliner at the 2022 Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade.

Speaking on representation and why that matters, Hollywould says, âAs a queer person and a person of colour, I feel like itâs ten times harder for us, especially, not having that representation. So, Iâm just Iâm so grateful to have this opportunity and for people to see that on the screen and know that itâs okayâ¦ and you know, they can do it tooâ, adding, âThere arenât many of us here in Australia who get this opportunity. I do not take it lightly.â

Isis Avis Loren

33, Melbourne Australia

Pronouns in drag: She/They

Pronouns out of drag: They/him/she

Isis Avis Loren encapsulates her audience with a mix of old-fashioned glamour & fierce, edgy entertainment.

Isis is a prominent queen of the Naarm, Melbourne, drag scene. Isis has graced many stages in Australia and overseas and with her high fashion couture creations made by her own hand, she is well known for her design and seamstress skills. A formidable competitor, this sweetheart certainly knows her way around a sewing machine, having dressed much of the elite Melbourne drag scene.

Ivanna Drink

26, Auckland New Zealand

Pronouns in drag: She/Her

Pronouns out of drag: He/Him

Ivanna Drink is a recognisable face on Aucklandâs Cabaret scene as resident Emcee and Showgirl. Her dazzling lewks are hard to miss and with her signature beaming smile. Married to Anita Wiglâit, she completes the power couple of drag.

With over 8 years of experience and tenure that expands over Australia and New Zealand, Ivanna has certainly gotten around! Highlights of her career include winning the Queen of Queens pageant, her role as 'Hooker #2' from the Netflix Show Cowboy Bebop & more recently a stint across the ditch for World Pride and Sydney Mardi Gras 2023.

Ivory Glaze

26, Sydney Australia

Pronouns in drag: She/Her

Pronouns out of drag: He/Him

Ivory Glaze brings beauty and glamour to the stage. With a love for fashion, her looks are always polished from head to toe, while pushing boundaries. Ivory is fairly new to the drag scene, and unlike some of her fellow competitors drag is not Ivoryâs fulltime occupation, but Ivoryâs bank job doesnât hold her back from exploring all things drag or prevent her from bringing her exuberance to the drag scene, as well as her sweet and wholesome personality.

Rita Menu

24, Hamilton New Zealand

Pronouns in drag: She/Her

Pronouns out of drag: He/Him

Our baby queen, Rita, has only been doing drag for a year. She considers herself super competitive and bills herself as a singer, dancer, and seamstress. Despite her lack of experience, Rita has already wowed audiences in the New Zealand drag scene with performances at local nightclubs as well as winning Kita and Anitaâs Drag Wars competition in Auckland.
